abstract: Creates a new group to which you can assign block objects.
overview:
## Return Value

The newly created group. In Objective-C returns `NULL` on failure.

## Discussion

This function creates a new group with which block objects can be associated (by using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function). The dispatch group maintains a count of its outstanding associated tasks, incrementing the count when a new task is associated and decrementing it when a task completes. Functions such as [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_notify] and [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_wait] use that count to allow your application to determine when all tasks associated with the group have completed. At that time, your application can take any appropriate action.

# init()

**Initializer**

Creates a new group to which you can assign block objects.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Return Value

The newly created group. In Objective-C returns `NULL` on failure.

## Discussion

This function creates a new group with which block objects can be associated (by using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function). The dispatch group maintains a count of its outstanding associated tasks, incrementing the count when a new task is associated and decrementing it when a task completes. Functions such as [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_notify] and [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_wait] use that count to allow your application to determine when all tasks associated with the group have completed. At that time, your application can take any appropriate action.
title: init()
